body:
Hi there,
I use short git commit hashes as docker tags and stumbled across a issue with helm.

```
Client: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.5.0", GitCommit:"012cb0ac1a1b2f888144ef5a67b8dab6c2d45be6", GitTreeState:"clean"}
Server: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.5.0", GitCommit:"012cb0ac1a1b2f888144ef5a67b8dab6c2d45be6", GitTreeState:"clean"}
```

## Issue
helm truncates integers with leading zeros.

## Example

`helm install --namespace tools --set deployment.dockerTag=0474915 helm/elastalert --debug --dry-run`  results in this:

```
USER-SUPPLIED VALUES:
deployment:
  dockerTag: 474915
```

```
spec:
      containers:
      - name: elastalert
        image: my-registry/elastalert:474915
```

The leading zero `0` gets truncated by helm which results in a kubernetes `imagePullError`.

I tried different quoting techniques with single and double quotes:
```
--set 'deployment.dockerTag=0474915'
--set "deployment.dockerTag=0474915"
--set deployment.dockerTag='0474915'
--set deployment.dockerTag="0474915"
```
All of them resulting in the same behavior described above.

this is the line from my template:
`image: {{ .Values.global.dockerRegistry }}/{{ .Values.deployment.dockerImage }}:{{ .Values.deployment.dockerTag }}`

Is there a way to stop helm from converting my values?
title: integer with leading zero gets truncated
